result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrick Ramon Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

superMiscConds.notes: Same as probation conditions, exception is the condition time.

supervisions.notes: Review hearing December 15, 2017 at 10:00 a.m. in Branch 36.

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees or civil judgment will be entered.

All Court costs, fees and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount deemed reasonable from wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account under Sec. 973.02(11)(c) and as a condition of Extended Supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor under 18 USC Section 922(g)(9); also advised that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
No contact with:  Jordan Grocery and Tobacco at 5611 N. Lisbon Avenue, Sunlite Mini Mart at 5331 W. Center Street, Appleton Mini Mart at 6143 W. Appleton Avenue.
Cooperate with additional requirements of the Mental health probation.

timeConds.notes: STAYED, to be used at agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Paige Aleece Styler in court.  Kelly Hedge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM 
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO JUDGE. Court further orders that bail is forfeited.

Attorney Paige Aleece Styler in court.  Kelly Hedge appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
cab
  Defendant failing to appear.  Defense counsel requests that the Court impose and stay a warrant.  State has no objection. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.Case adjourned to Branch 36 for a review hearing.
Per clerical error only, probation review hrg/date/time  now showing
Filed, sdg.

Defendant Derrick Ramon Robinson in court with attorney Meighan Martha Anger.  Defendant Derrick Ramon Robinson in custody.  Kelly Hedge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of TWENTY-SEVEN (27) MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence,  with credit for ONE HUNDRED THIRTY-FOUR (134) DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is FIFTEEN (15) MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is TWELVE (12) MONTHS.  The defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of TWENTY-FOUR (24) MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION/PROBATION:

* Co-operate with additional requirements of the Mental Health probation.
* Court ordered the defendant to serve ONE HUNDRED TWENTY (120) DAYS in the House of Correction.  STAYED.  To be used at agent's discretion.
* Defendant to have NO CONTACT with JORDAN GROCERY and TOBACCO at 5611 N Lisbon Avenue.
* Defendant to have NO CONTACT with SUNLITE MINI-MART at 5331 W Center Street.
* Defendant to have NO CONTACT with APPLETON MINI-MART at 6143 W Appleton Avenue.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor under 18 USC Section 922(g)(9).  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount deemed reasonable from wages and from other monies held in in the defendants inmate account under Sec. 973.02(11)(c) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 15, 2017 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
Court orders a $1,000.00 PR bond with turnover to JusticePoint. 

As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.

Defendant Derrick Ramon Robinson in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt.  Defendant Derrick Ramon Robinson in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months to 18 months.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Case transferred to br 6 for drug treatment court admissions on 7/1/2015 at 1:30pm.  lms

Original Transcript PRELIMINARY HEARING  (15 pages) commencing JANUARY 26, 2015 received and filed.

Defendant Derrick Ramon Robinson in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt.  Defendant Derrick Ramon Robinson in custody.  Michael Kessler, student intern under the supervision of Ronald Dague for Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Mark Pollard-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with 6143 W APPLETON AVE.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Defendant Derrick Ramon Robinson in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Derrick Ramon Robinson in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DONALD, Branch 2.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
